channel.title: Hand-picked content from people & professionals across world
channel.description: Hand-picked content from people & professionals across world

item.title: Along the Autism Spectrum, a Path Through Campus Life
item.description:
Along the Autism Spectrum, a Path Through Campus Life

But while these young adults have opportunities that could not have been imagined had they been born even a decade earlier, their success in college is still a long shot. Increasingly, schools are realizing that most of these students will not graduate without comprehensive support like the Kelly Autism Program at Western Kentucky.

item.title: A Guide to Solving Social Problems with Machine Learning
item.description:
A Guide to Solving Social Problems with Machine Learning

It's Sunday night. You're the deputy mayor of a big city. You sit down to watch a movie and ask Netflix for help. ("Will I like Birdemic? Ishtar? Zoolander 2?") The Netflix recommendation algorithm predicts what movie you'd like by mining data on millions of previous movie-watchers using sophisticated machine learning tools.

item.title: How To Get Involved And Support People With Disabilities - From Global To Local
item.description:
How To Get Involved And Support People With Disabilities - From Global To Local

Did you know that December 3rd is the "International Day of Persons with Disabilities" every year? How about that more than 1 in 10 residents of Illinois live with a disability, yet only 35% of working-age Illinoisans with disabilities have jobs?

item.title: Following Dreams, Blindly
item.description:
Following Dreams, Blindly

I have heard many stating that they want to make big in life. They look at the vast horizons with their naked eyes and desire to conquer every bit of it. Many of them can do wonders as they are physically able, mentally sound but what lacks is rock solid determination.

item.title: My Autistic Son's Lesson: No One Is Broken
item.description:
My Autistic Son's Lesson: No One Is Broken

My youngest son, Sawyer, used to spend far more time relating to his imagination than he did to the world around him. He would run back and forth humming, flapping his hands and thumping on his chest.

item.title: Creating a world that works for everyone with Google Impact Challenge: Disabilities
item.description:
Creating a world that works for everyone with Google Impact Challenge: Disabilities

More than a billion people have a disability. And regardless of the country or community they live in, the gaps in opportunity for people with disabilities are striking: One in three people with a disability lives in poverty.

item.title: IBMVoice: Age Matters: How To Prepare For A Billion People Over The Age Of 65 In The U.S.
item.description:
IBMVoice: Age Matters: How To Prepare For A Billion People Over The Age Of 65 In The U.S.

Within the next 15 years, the world will have close to a billion people over the age of 65, and for the first time in human history, people aged 65 and over will outnumber children under age 5 sometime before 2020.

item.title: Accessibility in OneNote 2016 for Mac - OneNote for Mac
item.description:
Accessibility in OneNote 2016 for Mac - OneNote for Mac

You can turn on accessibility features in OneNote for Mac to hear text read to you and to take advantage of other accessibility options.

item.title: Microsoft partners NGO Tamana to promote I-T based opportunities to autistic kids
item.description:
Microsoft partners NGO Tamana to promote I-T based opportunities to autistic kids

Microsoft partners NGO Tamana to promote I-T based opportunities to autistic kids 'Hour of Code', a global campaign by Microsoft, commits to increase access of computer science education to youth with a focus on specially-abled children.
